description:
The Argument Model Ontology (AMO) is an ontology that allows to describe argumentation according to the 'Toulmin Model of Argument'.

Version: 1.0.0

Argument.label: argument
Argument.description: An argument, or practical argument according to the 'Toulmin model of argument', focuses on the justificatory function of argumentation: practical arguments first find a claim of interest, and then provide justification for it.Each argument must be analyzed according to six interrelated components: claim, evidence, warrant, backing, rebuttal and qualifier. The first three elements, 'claim', 'data' and 'warrant', are considered as the essential components of practical arguments, while the second triad, 'qualifier', 'backing', and 'rebuttal', may not be needed in some arguments.

ArgumentationEntity.label: argumentation entity
ArgumentationEntity.description: An entity that takes part in an argument according to the 'Toulmin model of argument'.

Backing.label: backing
Backing.description: Sort of credentials that certifies the warrant - e.g., the OWL 2 document specifications.

Claim.label: claim
Claim.description: A fact that must be established - e.g., 'This is a consistent OWL ontology'.

Evidence.label: evidence
Evidence.description: A fact that represents a foundation for the claim - e.g., 'This ontology was developed in OWL'.

Qualifier.label: qualifier
Qualifier.description: Words or phrases that express the degree of certainty of the claim such as “certainly”, “possible”, “probably”, “presumably”, etc.

Rebuttal.label: rebuttal
Rebuttal.description: Restrictions that may be applied to the claim - 'Unless a reasoner for OWL 2 proves that it is not consistent'.

Warrant.label: warrant
Warrant.description: A statement bridging from the evidence to the claim - e.g., 'An ontology developed in OWL is a consistent OWL ontology'.

backs.label: backs
backs.description: A backing that attests the warrant of an argument.

forces.label: forces
forces.description: A qualifier that expresses as degree of force concerning a claim of an argument.

hasBacking.label: has backing
hasBacking.description: An argument includes a backing as one of its (optional) components.

hasClaim.label: has claim
hasClaim.description: An argument includes a claim as one of its (mandatory) components.

hasEvidence.label: has evidence
hasEvidence.description: An argument includes an evidence as one of its (mandatory) components.

hasQualifier.label: has qualifier
hasQualifier.description: An argument includes a qualifier as one of its (optional) components.

hasRebuttal.label: has rebuttal
hasRebuttal.description: An argument includes a rebuttal as one of its (optional) components.

hasWarrant.label: has warrant
hasWarrant.description: An argument includes a warrant as one of its (mandatory) components.

involves.label: involves
involves.description: An argument involves an argumentation entity (claim, evidence, warrant, backing, rebuttal) or a qualifier.

isBackingIn.label: is backing in
isBackingIn.description: An argumentative entity linked to an argument in which it is considered a backing.

isClaimIn.label: is claim in
isClaimIn.description: An argumentative entity linked to an argument in which it is considered a claim.

isEvidenceIn.label: is evidence in
isEvidenceIn.description: An argumentative entity linked to an argument in which it is considered an evidence.

isInvolvedIn.label: is involved in
isInvolvedIn.description: An argumentation entity involved in the presentation of an argument.

isQualifierIn.label: is qualifier in
isQualifierIn.description: An sentence or word linked to an argument with the scope of qualifying the argument claim.

isRebuttalIn.label: is rebuttal in
isRebuttalIn.description: An argumentative entity linked to an argument in which it is considered a rebuttal.

isValidUnless.label: is valid unless
isValidUnless.description: A claim that is restricted by a rebuttal of an argument.

isWarrantIn.label: is warrant in
isWarrantIn.description: An argumentative entity linked to an argument in which it is considered a warrant.

proves.label: proves
proves.description: An evidence that founds a claim of an argument.

relatesTo.label: relates to
relatesTo.description: An argumentation entity relates to another one in some way - for example, it is the evidence that is used to prove a claim of an argument.

supports.label: supports
supports.description: An evidence that supports a warrant of an argument.
